content:
• Thursday, September 15, 2011
  • BB

    Though Research In Motion (RIMM) is down 18% AH after a weak FQ2 report, execs tried their best...

    Though Research In Motion (RIMM) is down 18% AH after a weak FQ2 report, execs tried their best during RIM's CC to give a positive spin, claiming strong uptake for the latest BlackBerrys, and expressing confidence in the PlayBook's future. But it's hard to spin RIM's declining gross margin: it fell 5.2% Q/Q in FQ2, and is expected to fall another 2% in FQ3.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACAS

    American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS) says that since early August, it has made open market purchases...

    American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS) says that since early August, it has made open market purchases of 9.1M shares of at an average price of $8.21 per share, totaling $75M. The company also announced a plan to extend its buyback program to allow additional purchases through December 31, 2012, and use the shares for dividend payments. ACAS +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • EQNR

    Leading European oil stocks outperformed today on the heels of the ECB's relief effort. STO...

    Leading European oil stocks outperformed today on the heels of the ECB's relief effort. STO +3.5%. BP +3.2%. RDS.A +3%. E +3.4%. TOT +2.3%. Some major Euro tech names were also up strongly. NXPI +6.2%. ERIC +5.8%. ALU +3.8%. STM +5%. NOK +3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) FQ4 earnings easily beat estimates across-the-board on a 27% Y/Y...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) FQ4 earnings easily beat estimates across-the-board on a 27% Y/Y jump in revenue, as the packaged-food company benefited from better sales and a tax benefit. The company raises EPS guidance to $3.05 to $3.15 and revenue between $1.85B and $1.95B. Analysts projected EPS of $3.10 a share on revenue of $1.87B. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • ITMN

    Shares of Intermune (ITMN +2%) posted solid gains today after Credit Suisse initiates coverage...

    Shares of Intermune (ITMN +2%) posted solid gains today after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an outperform rating and a $37 price target. The firm calls it a "product ramp story" and a key pick within its mid/small cap coverage universe.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • BB

    More on Research In Motion's FQ2: 10.6M BlackBerrys shipped during quarter, below expectations...

    More on Research In Motion's FQ2: 10.6M BlackBerrys shipped during quarter, below expectations of 11M-12.5M. 200K PlayBook tablets shipped, below a Bloomberg consensus of 490K. 13.5M-14.5M BlackBerry shipments expected for FQ3, slightly below Street expectations of 14M-15M. $780M spent in Nortel patent auction. RIMM -13.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ2 EPS of $0.80 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $4.17B (-10% Y/Y) misses...

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ2 EPS of $0.80 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $4.17B (-10% Y/Y) misses by $300M. Company expects FQ3 revenue of $5.3B-$5.6B and EPS of $1.20-$1.40, compared with consensus of $5.27B and $1.36. Expects FY12 EPS at low end of prior range of $5.25-$6.00, but above $5.10 consensus. RIMM -10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • INFN

    Telecom hardware vendor Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) closed up 3.9%, and the company's unveiling of...

    Telecom hardware vendor Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) closed up 3.9%, and the company's unveiling of its DTN-X product may have played a role. Infinera claims the DTN-X, which leverages proprietary optical components and is due to begin volume shipments in Q2 2012, offers unmatched capacity for products combining optical switching and transmission functions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • NFLX

    At a media conference today, Netflix (NFLX -18.9%) content chief Ted Sarandos sounded...

    At a media conference today, Netflix (NFLX -18.9%) content chief Ted Sarandos sounded unapologetic about the company's price hike, even as shares are crushed following a weak subscriber forecast. BTIG speculates the adverse customer reaction to the hike may have affected Netflix's failed bid to hold onto Starz's library. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 6 Comments
  • CSH

    Payday lender Cash America (CSH +6.1%) says it plans to divest a majority ownership of...

    Payday lender Cash America (CSH +6.1%) says it plans to divest a majority ownership of wholly-owned subsidiary Enova International in an IPO; it would retain 35%-49% of its ownership interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT +3.4%) is higher today after Oppenheimer raised it to outperform with a...

    Applied Materials (AMAT +3.4%) is higher today after Oppenheimer raised it to outperform with a $16 price target. The firm cites a number of positive near-term catalysts for the company, including an early Chinese New Year and a new product pipeline, plus spending fundamentals are improving.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • ESRX

    Bernstein sees long-term risks for Express Scripts (ESRX -2.9%) if it can't iron out its dispute...

    Bernstein sees long-term risks for Express Scripts (ESRX -2.9%) if it can't iron out its dispute with Walgreen (WAG +1.6%). Citing a survey of big employers, Bernstein says a "bear scenario" could mean the loss of 25% of Express Scripts' book, but a contract termination "would represent a mutually destructive scenario, thus increasing the likelihood of settlement."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • ASCA

    Ameristar Casinos (ASCA +4.6%) trades up after authorizing the repurchase of up to $75M shares...

    Ameristar Casinos (ASCA +4.6%) trades up after authorizing the repurchase of up to $75M shares in a stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +4.2%) trades up on the day after Cowen says the stock should outperform in the...

    Textron (TXT +4.2%) trades up on the day after Cowen says the stock should outperform in the near-term, as the company's debt redemption plan reduces interest expenses and boosts earnings over the next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • UBS

    FT's John Gapper contends the UBS (UBS -10.9%) rogue trader news has shown that it has failed to...

    FT's John Gapper contends the UBS (UBS -10.9%) rogue trader news has shown that it has failed to overhaul its "accident-prone nature." Given the bank’s recent history, he writes, "it is fair to ask if Kweku Adoboli is a rogue trader or his employer is a rogue bank."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (UTHR -0.9%) is down today after Goldman Sachs cut the shares to neutral on...

    United Therapeutics (UTHR -0.9%) is down today after Goldman Sachs cut the shares to neutral on valuation, saying it sees greater upside potential and better relative value in Onyx (ONYX +4.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS +6.3%) shares hit their highs of the day, after John Mack announces his...

    Morgan Stanley (MS +6.3%) shares hit their highs of the day, after John Mack announces his retirement as chairman, to be replaced by James Gorman, who had already replaced Mack as CEO in 2009. Such seamless transitions are more unusual than one might expect, as companies and boards are often unprepared for changes at the top.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +4.4%) is trading higher today after Goldman Sachs ups the shares to...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +4.4%) is trading higher today after Goldman Sachs ups the shares to buy on valuation. Goldman says the company has a strong balance sheet, and ongoing trials expected within the next 12-18 months could increase the sales potential for Nexavar, a cancer-drug it sells with partner Bayer (BAYRY.PK +1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • PRTK

    It's a run-of-the-mill 97% gain for shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) following...

    It's a run-of-the-mill 97% gain for shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) following yesterday's announcement the FDA was "generally" on board with its Intermezzo drug. Even with the blockbuster day, shares of the micro-cap are still off 11% for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • TFM

    Fresh Market (TFM -2%) is lower today after Deutsche initiates it with a tepid hold rating,...

    Fresh Market (TFM -2%) is lower today after Deutsche initiates it with a tepid hold rating, citing the need for greater visibility on shopping patterns for the high-end grocer.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • NFLX

    More Netflix (NFLX -18.1%) commentary: Janney reiterates a Sell, citing both a high valuation...

    More Netflix (NFLX -18.1%) commentary: Janney reiterates a Sell, citing both a high valuation and concerns about growth, competition, and expenses; and multiple analysts think Hulu's sale will increase competitive pressures. But Merrill remains bullish, arguing Netflix's growing streaming revenue will allow it to buy more content to further differentiate its service.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • Z

    Shares of Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) drop 9%, yet remain an outperformer for the year in comparison to...

    Shares of Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) drop 9%, yet remain an outperformer for the year in comparison to the stocks of other companies gone public in 2011. Zillow's own mortgage survey shows rates at record lows, but the housing market (and Zillow) shouldn't hold their breath a housing boom is coming.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • NFLX

    It wasn't long ago that Netflix (NFLX -17.8%) shares actually rose following the company's...

    It wasn't long ago that Netflix (NFLX -17.8%) shares actually rose following the company's controversial price hike. But following today's guidance cut and bloodletting, Street skepticism abounds. Lazard's Brian Crockett, for example, believes Netflix's subscriber weakness could extend into Q4. Meanwhile, rival CSTR is up 7.3% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • FRED

    Discount retailer Fred's (FRED -2.7%) takes a hit today after Deutsche initiates it with a sell,...

    Discount retailer Fred's (FRED -2.7%) takes a hit today after Deutsche initiates it with a sell, citing headwinds related to its geographic exposure and pharmacy trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PDEX

    Pro-Dex (PDEX +10.8%) jumps after reporting a solid FQ4 yesterday. EPS came in at $0.31, a 19%...

    Pro-Dex (PDEX +10.8%) jumps after reporting a solid FQ4 yesterday. EPS came in at $0.31, a 19% jump Y/Y, while sales climbed 31% Y/Y to $7.5M, due primarily to a significant increase in medical device sales to its three largest customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • DS

    Add another one to the pile: Shares of Newcastle Investment (NCT) soar 18.5% after increasing...

    Add another one to the pile: Shares of Newcastle Investment (NCT) soar 18.5% after increasing its quarterly dividend by 50% to $0.15 per share. The company maintains it still has $85M of unrestricted cash to invest into opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.6%) pops after the Wall Street Journal says it's been contacted by potential...

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.6%) pops after the Wall Street Journal says it's been contacted by potential acquirers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • NUE

    Nucor (NUE +2.6%) continues to climb, despite saying earlier that it expects Q3 earnings to slip...

    Nucor (NUE +2.6%) continues to climb, despite saying earlier that it expects Q3 earnings to slip Q/Q due to lower steel prices and metal margins as well as continuing high raw material costs. Current price action indicates that the news has already been baked-in, since the company warned of lower profits when it reported its Q2 in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • KR

    Kroger's (KR +2.9%) Board of Directors approve a $1B share repurchasement program, replacing an...

    Kroger's (KR +2.9%) Board of Directors approve a $1B share repurchasement program, replacing an existing plan that had $213M in shares remaining to be bought. In addition, the company says it will reward investors with a 9.5% boost in its quarterly dividend - up to $0.115 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +3.3%) gains after Morningstar says the firm is an attractive...

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +3.3%) gains after Morningstar says the firm is an attractive takeover candidate because of its cash-rich balance sheet and depressed stock price. The report citing AEO makes the case that M&A activity with small-cap and mid-cap names will outpace bigger deals of over $10B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods Market (WFM +2.4%) trades higher after Deutsche initiates the shares with a buy,...

    Whole Foods Market (WFM +2.4%) trades higher after Deutsche initiates the shares with a buy, saying it has strong structural advantages in its healthy and organic product niche.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • HCA

    Some positive sentiment is washing over hospital stocks today, led by HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) as...

    Some positive sentiment is washing over hospital stocks today, led by HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) as it rocks a 10.5% gain following a share repurchasement announcement. Tenet Healthcare (THC +5.1%) and Community Health Systems (CYH +3.6%) also move higher, as investors start to move away from takeover chatter and focus on earnings and valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -2.6%) continues its downward slide after being initiated with a sell at Auriga...

    Suntech (STP -2.6%) continues its downward slide after being initiated with a sell at Auriga with a price target of $1 - a 73% discount from its current price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • ADS

    Alliance Data Systems (ADS +2.6%) says the delinquency rate for private-label cards it oversees...

    Alliance Data Systems (ADS +2.6%) says the delinquency rate for private-label cards it oversees for retailers fell in August Y/Y, though up slightly from the prior month. Charge-offs also declined on both a year-end basis and M/M through the end of July.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +2%) gets a boost after appointing independent director Robert H. Hotz as...

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +2%) gets a boost after appointing independent director Robert H. Hotz as chairman of the auto-parts retailer. He succeeds Max L. Lukens, who recently resigned "for personal reasons."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIG

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) racks up a 3.6% gain after Deutsche initiates coverage with a Buy rating and...

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) racks up a 3.6% gain after Deutsche initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $40 PT, saying shares set up for a gain in H2 when comparables ease and closeout deals hit. "Trends in consumables and furniture have turned the corner, which is key for traffic."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • KCG

    Knight Capital (KCG +3.1%) says domestic equity trading volume soared in August, which proved to...

    Knight Capital (KCG +3.1%) says domestic equity trading volume soared in August, which proved to be an intensely volatile month for all markets due to unprecedented macro events. The company reports 5.9M average daily U.S. equities trades, up 61% from July and 76.5% Y/Y. On a dollar basis, trading leapt to $41.4B, a 53% jump from July and 85% higher Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • MCS

    Theater and hotel owner The Marcus Corp. (NYSE:MCS) is up 15% after reporting FQ1 revenue of...

    Theater and hotel owner The Marcus Corp. (NYSE:MCS) is up 15% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $123.9M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.42, beating consensus by $7.7M and $0.02. Popular 3D films and a 9.8% increase in hotel revenue per available room helped drive growth. 442K shares were repurchased during the quarter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor's (AMSC -12.9%) bad year gets worse after the maker of wind turbine...

    American Superconductor's (AMSC -12.9%) bad year gets worse after the maker of wind turbine parts discloses it's suing Chinese customer Sinovel, demanding it pay for past product shipments and accept shipment of parts it's obligated to buy. AMSC's revenues collapsed this year following order cancellations from Sinovel.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • ILMN

    Ilumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) is down 3.7% after Leerink Swann downgrades the company to Market Perform,...

    Ilumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) is down 3.7% after Leerink Swann downgrades the company to Market Perform, and lowers its valuation range to $53-$57. The firm thinks the growth of Ilumina's high-end HiSeq genetic sequencing systems is decelerating over the short-term, and think NIH budget cuts could also hurt the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • COF

    Capital One (COF -3.4%) resumes its downtrend after reporting a sharp rise in charge-offs to...

    Capital One (COF -3.4%) resumes its downtrend after reporting a sharp rise in charge-offs to 4.1% in August from July's 3.77%. Delinquencies edge higher, to 3.43% from 3.37%. The moves are a reversal from recently improving credit quality.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • HCA

    Hospital operator HCA, which was taken public by its PE owners in March, rises 10.4% after...

    Hospital operator HCA, which was taken public by its PE owners in March, rises 10.4% after announcing it will repurchase 80.7M shares from Bank of America (NYSE:BAC). Three BofA-appointed board members will resign following the transaction, which will roughly give the bank a 3x return on its investment, originally made by Merrill Lynch's PE arm.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +8.8%) pops after saying the FDA has agreed to allow an early resubmission of its...

    Vivus (VVUS +8.8%) pops after saying the FDA has agreed to allow an early resubmission of its new drug application for Qnexa, for the treatment of obesity. The company plans to resubmit the application by the end of October.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • SVU

    Deutsche lifts up Supervalu (SVU +4.4%) with a Buy rating, giving the grocery chain credit for...

    Deutsche lifts up Supervalu (SVU +4.4%) with a Buy rating, giving the grocery chain credit for realistic earnings guidance and implementing positive initiatives. Deciding to wax a bit nostalgic, Deutscheadds that SVU reminds them of Saks (SKS -0.5%) and Macy's (M +1.5%) back in 08/09 - when "sentiment was just too negative relative to ongoing underlying changes."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC +1.77%) buys Israeli security systems firm Visonic Ltd. for around $100M in cash, in...

    Tyco (TYC +1.77%) buys Israeli security systems firm Visonic Ltd. for around $100M in cash, in an effort to boost its technology portfolio and strengthen its position in the intrusion security market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • ARCH

    Coal stocks come out of the gate charging after central bank coordination tips the scale back...

    Coal stocks come out of the gate charging after central bank coordination tips the scale back towards a rosier view on growth. The leader of the pack is Arch Coal (ACI +4.2%), rated a Buy by Deutsche on valuation and seen as a good defensive play. Other gainers: LLEN +3.6%, BTU +2.8%, CSX +1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • DOLE

    Shares of Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) jump 7% after catching an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight....

    Shares of Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) jump 7% after catching an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight. Shares still have a ways to go to retrace this summer's loss of 20% after earnings estimates were trimmed and analysts swept in with downgrades.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM

  • U.S. Treasuries dive following what appears to be a coordinated QE from the major Western...

    U.S. Treasuries dive following what appears to be a coordinated QE from the major Western central banks. Both the 10 and 30 years are down more than a full point in price. The yield on the 10 year up 12 basis points to 2.12%, the 30 year up 8 bps to 3.36%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 1 Comment

  • European shares are flying following central bank announcements of dollar funding availability...

    European shares are flying following central bank announcements of dollar funding availability to EU banks. Stoxx 50 +4.5%. The dollar is getting sold across the board. Gold is tumbling, -2% to $1,790/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • TTM

    Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) gains 3.7% premarket as the recent swoon in its share price begins to...

    Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) gains 3.7% premarket as the recent swoon in its share price begins to look overdone to investors following the carmaker's slumping sales and the resignation of its CEO. Jefferies chimed in with a Buy rating, saying the stock is priced in for a recession and Tata's balance sheet is well-positioned.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • AIXXF

    Aixtron (AIXG) -14.5% premarket after the German chip equipment maker sharply cuts its outlook...

    Aixtron (AIXG) -14.5% premarket after the German chip equipment maker sharply cuts its outlook for 2011 sales and operating margin. The news is "a massive negative surprise," said Equinet's Adrian Pehl, cutting his rating for the stock to Reduce from Buy. "The guidance was cut to the extent that one quarter's revenue would be missing."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • FANH

    CNinsure (CISG) is down 31.9% premarket after the Chinese insurance distributor states a going...

    CNinsure (CISG) is down 31.9% premarket after the Chinese insurance distributor states a going private proposal made by Chairman and CEO Yinan Hu in May has been withdrawn. Hu suggests "recent market conditions and near term volatility" made him think twice.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • FNDT

    Fundtech's (NASDAQ:FNDT) U.S.-listed shares +31% premarket after the Israeli financial services...

    Fundtech's (NASDAQ:FNDT) U.S.-listed shares +31% premarket after the Israeli financial services firm says a new offer from private-equity company GTCR tops an earlier all-stock bid from S1 (NASDAQ:SONE). FNDT calls the $23.33/share cash offer a "superior offer," and will ask its board to terminate its merger agreement with SONE and go with GTCR.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • ARX

    Shares of Aeroflex (NYSE:ARX) soar 9.2% premarket, helped along with a ringing Buy rating from...

    Shares of Aeroflex (NYSE:ARX) soar 9.2% premarket, helped along with a ringing Buy rating from Goldman Sachs and a $15 price target. The stock was added to the firm's Americas Conviction Buy List on the strength of its low valuation compared to peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • PWRD

    Chinese online gaming company Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD), which gained after reporting earnings...

    Chinese online gaming company Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD), which gained after reporting earnings in August, is down 7% premarket after lowering its Q3 revenue guidance range to $110M-$116M, from a prior $118M-$125M. The weaker guidance is blamed on lower in-game promotional activity for some of its current games. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM

  • European shares continue to charge higher, on track for a 3rd consecutive day of powerful gains....

    European shares continue to charge higher, on track for a 3rd consecutive day of powerful gains. Stoxx 50 +2.7%, Germany +2.4%, Italy +2%, Spain +2.8%, France +2.5%, U.K. +1.9%. The euro retakes the $1.38 level, +0.4% vs. the dollar.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is -4.2% premarket after lowering its Q3 U.S. subscriber growth forecast...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is -4.2% premarket after lowering its Q3 U.S. subscriber growth forecast to 21.8M streaming and 14.2M DVD, from a previous (July 25) 22M and 15M.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM | 8 Comments
  • UBS

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) -7% in Zurich, which some are calling an overreaction. But the question, Helvea...

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) -7% in Zurich, which some are calling an overreaction. But the question, Helvea says, is not the scope of the loss, but rather the suspicion the "unauthorized trades" are just UBS's I-bank traders "trying just a bit too hard to justify its existence. Hopefully, it will lead them to shrink the I-bank even more and faster than they were contemplating before," firm adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 AM
  • UBS

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) dives as much as 9.6% in Switzerland on news a rogue trader has lost about $2B....

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) dives as much as 9.6% in Switzerland on news a rogue trader has lost about $2B. UBS says no client positions were affected.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 AM | 4 Comments
